comment: This class was HARD, but I'm really glad I took it. I got the sense that she was used to teaching more advanced classes, but she explained everything in a way that I could understand it. The class was a lot of work, but I learned a heck of a lot. If you really like science but aren't a STEM major and just need a gen ed, I highly recommend her!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: King is spa very sweet & intelligent woman, however, she shouldnt be teaching an intro class. My friend took her & failed then took the other prof & made excellent grades. The material sent hard. Whats hard is the way she words questions. The bright side is that I failed every single test, but she curved like heck so I ended with a B.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Mrs. King was amazing. She gives you every chance to make a good grade. I got a 68 on every test and with the homework and extra credit, I passed with no problem. The class is just annoying. I hate science and I found the tests to be extremely difficult, but Mrs. King was beyond helpful. Definitely take her!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I dislike science and she actually made it easier to grasp. Would have done better if I had put a little more effort at the beginning of the semester. Love her class. Wish I could take her for the second part.
She is so passionate about environmental science and I would recommend her to absolutely anyone. Go to the SI sessions and study your notes and you'll be just fine!

I loved Prof King. Her tests are tough if you don't study and really know the material (ex. ALL/NONE of the above questions) and a lot of material is covered on one exam. Final exam isnt required if you like your grade and didn't miss a test. Drops lowest test grade. Posts all her lectures and helps you if you ask for it. Extra credit offered.

Not too difficult if you just do the work. She provides opportunities for extra credit. She has an amazing personality and loves the material. It is preferred that you attend class, but she doesn't take attendance. You can easily get the notes from a friend. The homework is really easy and the labs are not graded, but you should do them anyway.

I really enjoyed this class. Prof. King did a great job at making the material understandable and relevant.  4 exams + final. She drops the lowest exam and if you are satisfied with your grade after  4th exam you don't have to take the final. There is online homework as well as opportunities for extra credit. I WOULD DEFINITELY take her again.

I have never struggled this hard in a class before. I have never made a B before but I think I will make one in this class. You could study for HOURS AND HOURS and the tests are still ridiculously hard. She's nice and funny but this is not an easy class (like it should be).
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: DON'T TAKE HER. Take ANYONE ELSE. Had a couple of friends in the other classes who said their test matched the material given. NOT FOR KING. You can study ALL you want & you'll still struggle. Teaches pt 1,2,3 & tests on pt 4. It's a GenEd, not a lvl 4000. The only silver lining was that the online assignments / quizzes helped boost your grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: DO NOT TAKE. It is supposed to be a simple gen ed class, but she treats it like a nursing chemistry class. The tests are literally over every small thing she mentions in class and material comes from labs (about 20 pages of material), ppts (about 30 slides each; usually three a test), the textbook (30 pages on avg), and videos she shows.

5 tests, she drops the lowest one. The online homework is a great tool to bump your grade, and all the answers are on Quizlet. Powerpoints are fill in the blank which was kind of a pain for me. Lots of videos. Tests were hard and they covered EVERYTHING. Specific questions about the labs, videos, and even her personal experiences. TB not needed.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: 5 Tests, drops lowest grade + online HW. Funny lady, loves science, but for her tests study EVERYTHING she gives you, from the labs to the videos in class. DON'T waste time reading the book for the test unless she says. Her PP's are fill in the blank so come to class. Online assignments - search for answers in google.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Awesome teacher! As long as you actually go and pay attention in class, do the weekly online assignment, the study guide, and actually study for a little while you should be fine. She tries to make the information as simple as possible, and is always willing to explain and help if you don't understand something.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Love her! She is clear about what she expects & prepares you well for the tests with her lecture notes, study guides, & chat room Q&As. 5 tests - 1 is dropped. Weekly online HW. The class has 200 students, yet I can tell she cares when I need help. Come to class, prepare well for the tests, and you'll succeed. Definitely take her!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Talks about personal experiences that don't relate to what your going to be tested over. Talks about points A, B, & C, but tests over point D.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. King makes science so simple! She is by far one of the best professors I have ever taken! She works with her students if you need help with anything and is always available when you need her to be (schedule permitting). Attendance isn't mandatory, but trust me when I say if you make it a habit of skipping class, you will fall behind.

Goes over the tests in class and makes sure you understand why you got the question wrong. Does assign homework and it comes straight from the notes, I always get good grades on the homework, so that helps your grade.

I thought this is an entry level class. Tests are design to trip you up. No straight questions !! Confusing sources ( Text book, class lecture, lab, videos .....) She is also paranoid about cheating! Something must have happened. Class is for Chem. majors! My friends Professor simplifies the same material.
No I would not recommend her. Very unorganized and unclear.

This class was incredibly easy in my opinion. Her powerpoints are fill in the blank, and then her study  guides are basically the powerpoints but in a different format. She shows lots of videos to break up lectures, offers extra credit, and the tests are literally definition based. I have no idea how people failed this class.

Weekly online homework assignments. She does an online chat the night before every test to ask her specific questions over the material - this saved my grade. Her tests can be difficult, so study or you won't pass. Attendance is not mandatory. She leaves blanks in her notes online that you need to go to class to get filled in and explained though.
Her tests are very specific compared to her power points. She will not bump you up no matter how far you are from the certain letter grade.

She doesn' t give clear answers when students ask questions. There was homework every two weeks or so which is basically the same as her power points. Lectures for the whole class and it doesn't matter if you leave in the middle of it. One group project during the semester. 3 tests and a final, final replaces the lowest test grade.
Don't take King

While the class was challenging at times, it was mostly because i didn't put much effort into studying until the night before an exam. If you go home and review the lectures and don't cram, you should get an A with no problem. She is a great teacher and explains things really well. Highly recommend her !

For a supposedly easy course, it is very hard. Attendance is not mandatory, but she leaves a lot of blanks in the lectures and you have to go to class to get them. She holds chats before the tests so you can ask any questions, but the tests are very difficult.

Professor King is one of the best science professors around. She gives PPTs with blanks so you have to go to class to fill them in. She's there to help you. She does chats before tests on D2L so if you have any questions she'll answer them. Her tests get tough but they're definitely manageable. Don't have to take final if happy with your grade.

I'm a very good student  and I'm struggling to pass this class. You have to go to class bc all of her power points have blanks. Her study guides don't help with the test at all. The questions on the test are confusing and don't always apply to what we learned in class. Do not take her unless you're a science genius. She makes an intro course hard.

Attendance not mandatory but she posts her powerpoints online with blank spaces so you have to go to class to get all the information. Super nice lady willing to help you. Tests can be mildly difficult but as long as you do the labs, homework, and look over the powerpoints you should be fine. Not a science person and she made it easy to understand.

Professor King is nice, but that's not saying much. The material she covers in class is very basic, but her test are very hard. Lots of confusing and long questions. She has study guides, but they're mostly useless as a lot of the questions on the study guide do not appear on test. Unless you really love science, do NOT take her!

Going to be VERY upfront here. I'm a hardworking student & as of now I have a D. Do NOT take this class for Sci I. DO NOT. Tests are short BUT wording is on a whole other lvl than what is taught. ALL labs (most labs are IRRELEVANT to what we learn!) AND videos we watch are on the test. SOO much is crammed into a short test. Avoid King. AVOID. KING.
Dr. King was a pretty good professor. Her lectures are interesting, not too much howework. Make sure you complete the MES assignments and study before exams, and you will pass!
Even though she doesn't make you come to class, go. She is great at explaining these scientific concepts even to the non-science minded. Also, she can be really funny in class.

Go to class to get notes for the PPTs, all of the online HW answers are on Google.  Don't do the labs, just know what you were supposed to do for them, or what they asked. The tests are kinda hard, you do ave to study.  You get 2 bonus questions on exam that always help. You should be able to get a B, I got an A. Study for tests and you'll be fine.

I did not like her... She made her tests pretty difficult considering that she gave a study guide that covered only 30% of the test. Her lectures were really boring and you have to fill in her powerpoints. I used the textbook to study for the tests. Weekly hw is a must, don't skip or it will hurt you. Labs are really really easy

I did not like her... She made her tests pretty difficult considering that she gave a study guide that covered only 30% of the test. Her lectures were really boring and you have to fill in her powerpoints. I used the textbook to study for the tests. Weekly hw is a must, don't skip or it will hurt you. Labs are really really easy and big on exams.

Prof. King is a very good teacher. She's kind, funny, and has a great way of explaining things. If you don't understand a concept, she'll work with you until you get it. The tests aren't too bad, but you have to study to make an A in this class. Lectures are interesting. Attend class to make sure you have all the notes. Would recommend!

Long lectures. She posts the powerpoints, but you need to go to class to fill them in. There are labs, but they are not grade, but they're on the test (don't do them, just understand what's going on). She shows a lot of videos, which I found wasted to much time. The tests were hard, get ready to study alot. And HW once a week (but QUIZLER helps!).

This class was super easy. You don't need to buy the textbook, you will never use it. Online HW once a week, which gives you a brief activity to do then answer questions on it. Lectures can seem long. PowerPoints have missing parts, your reward to going to class is getting those blanks. Labs are not graded, but on test. Easy test, gives study guide

Professor King has power points that you must fill in the blanks when you bring them to class, but the class is not hard overall. She has 4 tests and will drop the lowest test grade with the final. You will have a mastering assignment to do about every week. She is very invested in the subject and fair to her students.

If you're looking for an easy A don't take her, she's really nice, but she leaves blanks in her powerpoints once she uploads them onto d2l, and the blanks are most likely the answers to the study guide. She doesn't grade labs, but they're on the test and if you want to get them right you have to have them memorized word for word.
Tests are extremely hard!! Homework is all online you can use a book but be careful!! Labs are online some are difficult and she doesn't go over them in class. All in all do not take her!!

She is a great professor for an upper level course. If you want to make a decent grade, you must attend every lecture and take notes. Her test questions come from the notes and the labs, and rarely from the book. I liked her and she is great, but very, very challenging.
Very hard professor.  Expects you to learn like an upperclass student in this course.  If you expect to take a class with an easy grade do not take her!
Very tough.  I do not suggest taking her if you expect an easy class.  I think she could definitely offer extra credit.  She expects you to learn at an upperclass level.

GREAT TEACHER!NOTeasy.A/B:MUST be in class listening&taking notes. do labs,&homework EARLY,NOT night before AND thoroughly go over b4 tests.enjoy science&good at it?teacher 4 u.loves what she does.dnt like science,but want to learn something&get moneys worth 4 a GenEd class,class for you, beware WILL be tough.want an easy A,little effort NOT 4 U

This class is not hard I got a B. we had 4 test and a final lowest test dropped. Multiple choice exams. If you go to class and study power points you will do fine. She post everything she goes over and videos too. This class is common sense if you ever took any kind of science.

Yes this class is hard, and yes you will have to put a lot of effort into it, but she is so helpful and gives so many extra credit opportunities there is no way you shouldn't at least make a B. I made a B with minimal effort, wish I tried harder, could've made an A. She is a great professor, provides study guide and materials necessary to succeed.
She is way too excited about this subject. She makes it way too hard for a gen ed class. Tests are incredibly hard, and labs are super detailed. Do not take her

DO NOT TAKE HER. I thought this would be an easy class based of ratings and it's not. Most of it is self taught and she makes it seem easy and then the tests are impossible. Just don't. I don't get why ksu can't get decent lower level science professors....

Easy A if u do the labs 10 quest from those on tests. Read the bk its not long some ex will be on tests from the bk. Come 2 class most of the ex she gives will be on the tests.Record lectures if u need to.Extra credit quest on tests. She is fair when grading tests.Tests are not tricky straight from the lecture.A with moderate effort.B with minimal.

Valerie King is awesome! if you do what you're suppose to do (such as doing labs, reading book and taking notes)you'll do great.LABS ARE 10-12% OF TEST so don't play around with them,it can drop an entire letter grade on your exam. she loves her job and makes it interesting, plus she gives extra credit.how good does it get?

She is one of those teachers who gets WAY too excited over the subject and is really annoying to listen to in class. The labs are WAY to detailed to understand and her tests are super hard. If you are not a good test taker or dont care for science DO NOT take her!

Is not very helpful when asked questions on the labs, there is so much information that she does not specify that you need to know for the test. Too hard for an entrance course, very passionate about the subject though. Teaches straight from powerpoints, I wouldn't recommend anyone take her

She makes this class very easy to do well in. As long as you come to class, take notes, read the book, and do the labs. Notes are taken from power-points that are given to you online with fill in the blanks. It sounds like a lot, but it really isn't. She isn't the most exciting teacher, but she is very interactive and helpful. I would recommend her!

TAKE HER!  She explains things thoroughly and clearly, and she puts powerpoints and videos seen in class on Vista. Questions from labs are on the tests, otherwise the labs aren't used.  She handles a class of 200 very well!  Totally recommend!

1101 course- weekly online homework, easy. Labs are all things that you do on the computer or print out and do. They are not for a grade, but she'll always incorporate questions about them into the test. In class she reads her Powerpoints in class. Tests are easy if you read the material in the text, on the labs, and on the online homework.

Mrs. King is great! Yeah her tests aren't EXACTLY like the study guide BUT she is super helpful and isn't a stickler about texting, laptops, or talking in class. She is super sweet and will not hesitate to help if asked. Online assignments are a piece of cake and she gives you a long time to get them finished. I would recommend her to anyone!

Ms. King is a great instructor! She gives note outlines, and if you show up for class, complete the outlines and do the study guide, you will make an A! She is very interesting and shows a lot of movies and objects to help you understand what she is talking about!
4 tests, you can exempt the final if you like your grade. I studied SO hard for all the tests and always made C's; had a 4.0 until this class

Excellent teacher! Used a wonderful example of exponential growth in an r-selected species by telling us about a personal experience she had when her own fridge lost power during a holiday. Also, INFINITELY patient with students who asked the same dumb questions over and over and OVER again.

Professor King is a nice lady. However, I found her tests to often be very confusing in the way that the questions were worded. The lab questions in particular are a bit random as well. Science is not my favorite subject and this class didn't help increase my interest in the subject.
I did not want to take ANY science class and wound up loving this class and Prof King! If you go to class and pay attention, easy A. Highly recommend...

she is fine but her quiz and test is most form the note and stupid question from what she said in the class. like what she said about her incident when her fridge was out of power. Never miss a class or you can not make it up.

Professor King is very nice. Attendance is optional. Gives you power points to follow along with- makes it easy to take notes. Four exams and a final, drops the lowest test grade. Good teacher, would take her again for 1102 if she was offered!

EASY class. attendance OPTIONAL.gives studyguides and tells you EXACTLY what you need to know for test. final optional. holds online chats before tests-VERY HELPFUL (hints at what will be on test). you DONT actually need to do the labs- just read them and understand the main points and what it was ASKING you to do(if you were to do them). made an A

If you go to class and read the book you will get a B with minimal work, tests are only difficult if you like to skip class. I definitely recommend her! She also puts extra credit questions on every test.

I really hated this class. I worked really hard and still did not get the grade I wanted. The lab questions on the test were irrelevant in many cases. Her tests were so hard. I like how she has powerpoint as her class notes. Attend class. A lot of the test questions come from the fill ins.

her lectures are boring, but they're easy to understand.. her tests are very hard and the study guides don't have a lot of the stuff she puts on the test. i liked that she dropped the lowest test grade and she didn't really use the book, but i wouldn't recommend her. you really have to work hard for an A.

Prof. King is extremely helpful. She gives study guides for each test and has a online chat session where you can ask questions before the test. She also gives 5 tests with the highest 4 grades counting. Class was interesting too, she is lively. I thought this class was easy, but unlike most people I attended class and studied her study guides.

BUY THE BOOK, ATTEND CLASS, and DO THE LABS. She was extremely helpful in providing study guides and online study sessions before exams. You can ask her anything regarding the tests and she will help. She wants people to succeed, but it is up to them to do the work. Quit complaining, this is college!

prof king loves what she is teaching. she knows what she is talking about. offers online chat sessions before tests to help study which was extremely helpful. but the tests are very hard. dont just learn definitions, etc you have to be able to apply them. online labs dont get graded but lotsa questions on the tests to see if you did them.

Absolutely hated this professor. Didn't buy the book but studied my butt off for all the tests and STILL made F's and D's on all the tests. She is very boring and expects you to know everything she's talking about in great detail for her tests. I would NOT take her unless you are a Science guru.

VERY BORING! I fell asleep a few times and so did the majority of other students. She is hard, not helpful when you email her. Her voice is boring, all she talks about is how she wanted to be a marine biologist and study the ocean, but now she is a teacher. Tests are very hard. You must buy a text book to help study before the test. Dont take her!!

If your interested and understand marine biology then you may do well if you go to class, takes notes, and pay attention.  This really isnt a general science class, its more of an environmental class with a focus on the oceans.  DONT TAKE HER CLASS. Her tests are about 50% pointless labs and 50% pointless information.  Memorize stats in notes.

If you come to class, take notes, read the book (short-assigned pages), do the labs, and STUDY, you will do very well.That's college.Five exams and lowest exam dropped.Labs are not due but are comprehensive on the exam.A lot of people come to class on exam days and this kills your grade in any class.Answers any questions before each exam.

This class is hard, There are 5 test grades but she drops the lowest one. Its not a class where you memorizes a definition and get the answer right, you have to completely understand it and be able to apply it on the test. You need to  read the book and you have to take the notes or you will fail this class. Lab work is proven on the test.

She is very boring.  she talks to her class as if they know everything already. you will only get a good grade in this class if you have already taken upper level classes or took AP science classes all throughout high school.  She doesnt assign homework but she wont give you a study guide for any test until the night before or 2 nights before.
If you go to class and do your work you will get an A.. Little bit of studying required for A or B but nothing overwhelming. She is very nice and provides study sessions. Good option

AWESOME PROFESSOR!  Go to class, DO THE LABS, and take notes seriously.  She is very clear and doesn't mind explaining things until you completely understand them.  Tests can be a little tricky, but if you study you'll be fine.  I got a high A in the class and she is SO NICE and really into what she is teaching.  I would take her again.
King is by far the worst teacher Ive had. I went to class every day, met with her for help, did my work, etc. and still failed all but the last test. Everyone Ive talked to also got a C in her class.

Prof. King is extremely sweet and always willing to help. I found that her tests were a bit tricky, especially with the lab questions. However, this class is definitely not impossible to pass. Not an easy A but def. an easy B.

Professor King's class was okay.  I got a B, but the problem is that there is the right answer and then her answer on the test.  She doesn't require you to do the labs for a grade, but you better do them b/c they will be on the test.  I would say if you go to class and READ THE BOOK you will do fine.

Very boring class. Tests are straight from the notes, but some of the labs are ridiculous.  If you pay attention and attempt the labs you'll have a B, a little work and you'll have an A. She's okay, but there are better professors at KSU

Very boring class. Tests are straight from the notes, but some of the labs are ridiculous.  If you pay attention and attempt the labs you'll have a B, a little work and you'll have an A. She's okay, but there are better professors at KSU

She is the EASIEST science teacher ever!!! Test are straight from the notes! She will answer any questons you have about the material prior to the test!! Subjet matter is nothing but stuff you already learned since middle school!! I got an A with no problems
She is a great teacher! Go to class and fill in the blanks on the powerpoints. If you don't do well in this class you can only blame yourself. Drops the lowest test grade. Must read the labs!

Not a very good teacher.  Read the book more than anything and good luck with the labs b.c they are confusing and she picks specific questions from them that you wont remember to put on the test.  If she didnt include the labs on the test i could have made an A or high B but instead I'm pulling a low C. Good luck if you take her!

My only complaint is that the lectures were very boring. But honestly, she does teach what's on the test and is very helpful when answering questions. If you need to read a specific section of the book for a test, she will tell you. She's not a bad teacher, you'll just have to pay attention, like you should be doing in all of your classes.

listen closely to the words that you are reading. AVOID PROFESSOR V. KING! i ran a simple statistics test on tests averages for my class of around 180 students. in order from first test to third 66,68,69..her tests are worded in a confusing manner, the study guides are irrelevant, notes are somewhat helpful, to make a PASSING GRADE,read the book.

I enjoyed this class, and Professor King is amazing. It is a lecture class so it does tend to get boring. Attendances are not mandatory, and the only grades are 4 tests with an optional final; however, tests are extremely detailed. I've been to class everyday and study my butt off, but have made 1 B and 2 C. Study guides are different from tests.

Prof King knows this subject very well. This was a hard class for me. I attended every class and took notes. She posts a study guide which is very helpful but her tests seem to be worded differently and they do not feel like 1101 tests- they are much more detailed than I expected. She drops your lowest grade though.
What she teaches and on the study guides is NOT on the test! What kind of stuff is that?

Take her only if you are interested in pursuing Science as a major. Her tests are hard and if you don't study, you WILL fail. Unlike a lot of other science professors she makes you do all of the labs. The labs are time consuming, boring and have nothing to do with what we are learning in class.

Very easy, she is a good teacher and very knowledgeable about her field. The only set back was the size of the class; i like to get to know my teachers. She drops the lowest test grade and she gives you study guides; thus, easy.

The most underrated Professor I have seen on this site. She gives you all the resources you need to pass this class. You just have to show up and pay attention. She does make you do the labs. Drops the lowest of 3 test grades. She is also very nice and personable.

Ms. King was great!  She lets you drop one test grade, her powerpoints are fill in the blank, but easy to find outside of class. Go to the videos she shows in class! Very easy class, take her! I loved her class!

King is a great teacher! Her lectures were accompanied by a powerpoint she gives you in advanced too bring to class. She leaves few blanks in the lecture to fill in and if you miss they are easy to find in the book. Her tests are not hard and all multiple choice. She allows 1 dropped test grade and gives extra credit. Loved her class, TAKE IT!!!

Awesome teacher! She is very helpful and offers extra credit if the whole class doesn't do so great on tests. There are 4 lab sets/quizzes and 3 exams + a final. Lowest normal exam is dropped. Don't believe the low ratings here.. I thought she was a very good instructor! Tells cute stories. Very personable!

love her! she really helps you out; if the whole class does poorly on a test she gives extra credit, and she always drops the lowest exam grade. very easy to talk to one on one, but her lectures are kind of tedious. all the powerpoints are online, just go to class, fill in the blanks, and pay attention to the movies she shows and you'll do fine :)
easy note taking class she gives you the powerpoints before the lecture and you just have to fill in the blanks. she gives a study guide before the test but they are very in depth and confusing.
She is nice and helpful and means well. As long as you actually do the work (there isn't much to do) it's super easy to get a decent grade.
She is so nice and helpful throughout the course.  She only uses powerpoints and a few videos.  The class gets a little boring but notes are easy and you can make an A if you study.
She is nice and she means well but her class is really boring. This is not an easy a but the lowest test score is dropped.
she tries to be helpful which is good but she rushes thru the teachings questions on test and quiz are tricky would not recoment her at ALL better off taking the class with someone else

Sci 1101 is boring. Prof. King posts powerpoint slides online with blanks in them, you fill in the blanks during the lecture. The labs are an environmental propaganda regimen (surprise surprise) but are not too difficult. Overall, not a difficult course, just get the notes, do the labs and study the notes before exams and you should be fine.

Professor King is a very nice lady but her tests are rediculous. The labs are random and a waste of time. I failed all 3 of them and still read them. I dont recommend taking this class unless you really have a passion for the subject.

Prof King was a decent teacher. I was in a large auditorium class first thing in the morning so it was very hard to pay attention. She posts all of her powerpoints online, but there are in class assignments and you need to do 5. She also posts study guides for the tests which are helpful

She's pretty difficult. Her lab quizzes are hard and over material that has nothing to do with the class. Tests are hard too. Lecture and powerpoint all class. Nice lady, but not an easy "A" by any means. Do all the labs don't just read them.
She is a good professor. I find her a bit boring but overall I like her.
She is a great teacher!

Difficult to understand and to deal with. Gave detailed power points but there were still alot of unanswered material on tests. Would not let me make up a test even though I had proof I was admitted to the ER! Labs were on line and she gave quizes with VERY detailed questions.  Avoid her if you are looking for an easy A or B in this 1st year course

You nee to go to class!  She takes roll for 50 points.  She is VERY anal!  If you have a borderline grade...TOO BAD! NO X-tra credit. Convoluted lectures.  DETAILED lab quizes that I failed even though I Did EVERY lab!  Avoid this professor!!! NOT A GOOD TEACHER!

I loved taking Mrs. King's class.  She was very clear in her syllabus, and I learned a lot.  It's not hard to go to class and fill in the blanks in the notes that she posted.  And ALL OF THE TESTS WERE FROM THE NOTES!!!  She's a lovely lady.

she is a really good teacher. she knows her information. there are only 12 labs that are all online, 4 tests, and 5 participation grades. if you go to class youll get your notes and actually do well on the test
Great teacher. She explains things very well but the tests are kinda hard & tricky. 12 labs & 4 tests & 5 participation grades. Good teacher & I would take her again :)
Easy. All I had to do was go to class and read the book and notes. I also found that all of the thigs she taught did correlate to the tests. I would take her again.

I read these reviews but chose to take the class anyways...it was really easy, granted i did all the work, attended class every time, and took all the notes...but she hands you everything you need, sometimes there are random bonus questions you will only know if you go to class and hear stories...SO GO TO CLASS!!! it was fun

This class was very hard! She posted all of the notes online, but they had absolutely nothing to do with the tests. There is no way to study for this class...do not take her if at all possible!! Good luck!

all the ratings below are correct. There is no way to study for the test so unless you are familiar with science before hand, you will not do well unless you cheat.
